decks.notes: The main focus of this Grixis Control deck is to control the board and disrupt the opponent's strategy through removal spells and counterspells. The deck includes various cards to remove threats, counter key spells, and dig for more answers. Additionally, it utilizes powerful finishers like Torrential Gearhulk and The Scarab God to close out the game once the opponent's resources have been exhausted. By controlling the game and dictating the pace of play, this deck aims to outlast the opponent and secure victory through incremental advantage.

This deck focuses on fast and aggressive gameplay, using low-cost creatures and burn spells to quickly deal damage to the opponent. The creatures have abilities that help push through damage, while the burn spells provide additional reach to finish off the opponent. The deck aims to apply constant pressure and force the opponent to react defensively, allowing the player to maintain control of the game and close out the match before the opponent can stabilize.

The main concept of this Golgari Aggro deck is to utilize cards like Winding Constrictor, Walking Ballista, and Verdurous Gearhulk to quickly build up a strong board presence and overwhelm the opponent with powerful creatures. Additionally, the deck includes cards like Glint-Sleeve Siphoner and Rishkar, Peema Renegade to provide card advantage and mana acceleration, allowing for a fast and aggressive playstyle. Vraska's Contempt is included for removal and Skysovereign, Consul Flagship for additional damage and control. Overall, this deck focuses on fast creature aggression and efficient card advantage to take down opponents swiftly.

This deck focuses on quickly dealing damage to the opponent through aggressive creatures and burn spells. By utilizing efficient creatures like Soul-Scar Mage and Earthshaker Khenra, as well as powerful burn spells like Shock and Lightning Strike, the deck aims to apply constant pressure on the opponent while maintaining card advantage with cards like Bomat Courier. Hazoret the Fervent serves as a powerful finisher, while cards like Ahn-Crop Crasher provide additional ways to push through damage and close out games swiftly.

This deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with a fast and aggressive strategy, utilizing cards that provide additional value through +1/+1 counters and energy generation. The deck focuses on early creature presence with cards like Winding Constrictor and Walking Ballista, and finishes off opponents with big threats like Verdurous Gearhulk. Removal spells like Fatal Push and Vraska's Contempt help to clear the way for attacks, while cards like Glint-Sleeve Siphoner allow for card advantage. The Golgari color combination provides a strong mix of creatures and removal spells to maintain board control and pressure the opponent.

This Grixis Aggro deck focuses on utilizing a mix of removal spells and powerful creatures to aggressively control the board and pressure the opponent. The deck includes cards like Fatal Push, Vraska's Contempt, and Abrade to deal with threats, while also running strong creatures like Glorybringer, The Scarab God, and Torrential Gearhulk to quickly close out games. The deck aims to disrupt the opponent's game plan while maintaining a steady stream of threats to apply pressure and secure victory.

The deck focuses on playing aggressive creatures and burn spells to quickly reduce the opponent's life total. By utilizing powerful creatures such as Hazoret the Fervent and Earthshaker Khenra, along with efficient burn spells like Shock and Lightning Strike, the deck aims to deal damage early and often. The inclusion of cards like Soul-Scar Mage and Kari Zev, Skyship Raider help maintain pressure on the opponent, while cards like Abrade and Ahn-Crop Crasher provide additional versatility and disruption. The overall strategy is to overwhelm the opponent with a fast and relentless onslaught of damage.

The main concept of this Dimir Control deck is to disrupt the opponent's game plan by countering spells, removing threats, and controlling the board with cards like Disallow, Fatal Push, and Vraska's Contempt. The deck aims to outvalue the opponent by utilizing cards like Search for Azcanta and The Scarab God to gain card advantage and maintain board presence. Additionally, the deck has access to powerful finishers like Torrential Gearhulk and The Scarab God to close out the game once it has stabilized. The mana base is designed to support the control strategy with minimal color screw.

The primary strategy of this deck is to overwhelm the opponent by generating a large number of token creatures. Cards like Anointer Priest, Regal Caracal, and Sunscourge Champion help create and buff tokens, while spells like Fumigate and Settle the Wreckage provide control against opposing threats. Anointed Procession doubles the token production, while Hidden Stockpile provides a steady stream of tokens. Adding in removal spells and efficient mana sources rounds out the deck, allowing for a powerful aggressive strategy focused on token generation.

The main focus of this deck is to control the board through removal spells and counterspells while slowly building up card advantage with card draw effects. The creatures in the deck are mainly defensive, with the ability to gain life or create tokens to stall the game. The win condition of the deck is to outvalue the opponent with powerful threats like The Scarab God and Regal Caracal. The deck also includes land destruction to disrupt the opponent's mana base and prevent them from casting their spells effectively.

This deck focuses on utilizing Gate to the Afterlife to quickly get God-Pharaoh's Gift onto the battlefield, allowing you to reanimate powerful creatures from your graveyard. By controlling the board with removal spells like Fatal Push and Ravenous Chupacabra, as well as card draw engines like Glint-Sleeve Siphoner and Champion of Wits, you can out-value your opponent and overwhelm them with a steady stream of threats. The deck has a strong midrange game plan and aims to grind out victories through card advantage and powerful reanimated creatures.

This Gruul Aggro deck focuses on aggressive creatures and powerful removal spells to quickly overwhelm the opponent. The deck includes strong early game creatures like Voltaic Brawler and Merfolk Branchwalker, supported by removal spells like Magma Spray and Abrade to deal with threats. The mid to late game is dominated by powerful threats like Rekindling Phoenix and Glorybringer, with Hazoret the Fervent providing additional reach. The goal of the deck is to apply constant pressure and deal damage quickly to close out the game before the opponent can stabilize.

The main focus of this deck is to quickly overwhelm the opponent with aggressive red creatures and burn spells. The goal is to deal damage as quickly as possible while also controlling the opponent's board with cards like Abrade and Field of Ruin. Chandra, Torch of Defiance and Hazoret the Fervent provide additional card advantage and late game reach. The deck aims to be fast and efficient, ending the game before the opponent can stabilize.

The main focus of this deck is to quickly establish a board presence and apply pressure on the opponent through a combination of efficient creatures and removal spells. By utilizing cards that generate energy like Glint-Sleeve Siphoner and Servant of the Conduit, the deck aims to ramp up and maintain a strong board presence with threats like Walking Ballista and The Scarab God. The synergy between cards like Winding Constrictor and Jadelight Ranger helps to further bolster the aggression of the deck, while cards like Vraska's Contempt and Fatal Push provide answers to opposing threats.

The main focus of this deck is to control the game through counterspells and removal spells while generating card advantage with draw spells. This allows the player to stall the game until they can play their win condition, Torrential Gearhulk, to close out the game. The deck also includes some utility lands to help with card selection and mana fixing. It is designed to disrupt the opponent's game plan while consistently drawing into the necessary cards to maintain control.
